q: said. flacco, who played at delaware, said he has been treating the job as if it were his from the start. "that's the way i've been approaching it," flacco said. it's just a good opportunity for us to go out there and me to go out there as the quarterback and do as much as i can do to help this team win. flacco has taken his lumps of late, throwing two interceptions in a loss to tennessee and losing a critical fumble in an overtime loss to pittsburgh. campaign taken seriously. king said he realizes some americans can't fathom voting for a black man but told them to "ask god to help you pretend that Barack Obama is white" when they step into the. i understand very well that after more than three centuries of being taught, conditioned and indoctrinated to hate the black man as your inferior, it is unrealistic to think that now you can just change to respect him, king wrote. he predicted Barack Obama would have had an easy victory in this election if he were white.
